about_the_game:
Mimic is an online multiplayer survival horror game where players (5 in matchmaking, up to 8 in private lobbies) must work together to get off a doomed spaceship, the Icarus. An alien creature, the Mimic, is disguising itself amongst the survivors and the Icarus has been set on a collision course with the nearby sun. The alien can be disguised as anyone, and stalking the corridors of the Icarus are killer maintenance droids; hunting down survivors to remove the alien threat, killing indiscriminately and relentlessly.

Throughout the match, players can vote and send commands to the android to hunt a specific player down, they can sabotage escape attempts, and sow chaos amongst those playing. Players must figure out who they can trust their lives with and work together, or are all doomed to share the same fate.

Player Roles

The Crew
The crew players must repair the escape shuttle and escape the ship before it is destroyed. However, they must unlock security access and evade the killer androids. They can only successfully escape if they escape without the Mimic amongst their party.

The Agent
One of the human players is a corporate agent, sent by the corporate owners of the Icarus to secretly gather evidence, complete their own secret objectives; and ensuring no witnesses leave the ship alive but them.

The Mimic
The Mimic is disguised as a human but may reveal their selves at any time to feed and lay their eggs. Their sole desire to escape the ship alive.

Features:

Public Matchmaking and Private Lobbies
In public matchmaking the rules are set, but in a private lobby anything goes. Want you to be joined by up to 7 other friends? Want 3 Droids? 4 Mimics? Everlasting fire spreading damage? The rules are made by you so go crazy and have fun in a private lobby.

Vote to Survive
At terminals around the ship, you can cast your vote to send commands to the AI android roaming the halls to target a specific player. Don't trust someone? Send the android to do your dirty work.

Explore the Icarus
Find Mementos, audio logs, testimonies and reports to discover the truth about the Icarus and its crew and discover the source of the Mimic creature.

WARNING: PHOTOSENSITIVITY/EPILEPSY SEIZURES - READ THIS NOTICE BEFORE PLAYING


A very small percentage of people may experience epileptic seizures or blackouts when exposed to certain kinds of flashing lights or light patterns. These persons, or even people who have no history of seizures or epilepsy, may experience epileptic symptoms or seizures while playing video games. If you or any of your relatives has an epileptic condition or has had seizures of any kind, consult your physician before playing any video game.

IMMEDIATELY DISCONTINUE use and consult a physician if you or your child experience any of the following symptoms: dizziness, altered vision, eye or muscle twitching, involuntary movements, loss of awareness, disorientation, or convulsions. Parents should watch for or ask their children about the above symptoms.

You may reduce risk of photosensitive epileptic seizures by taking the following precautions: sit farther from the screen, use a smaller screen, play in a well-lit room, do not play when you are drowsy or fatigued.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 64-bit
  • Processor: Intel® Core™ i5-6600 (3.30 GHz) | AMD Ryzen™ 3 3100 (3.60 GHz) or Ryzen™ 5 2600 (3.40 GHz)
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia GeForce® GTX 980 | AMD Radeon™ RX 470 | Intel® Arc™ A750
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 10 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10/11 64-bit
  • Processor: Intel® Core™ i5-8400 (2.80 GHz) | AMD Ryzen™ 5 3600X (3.80 GHz)
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia GeForce® GTX 2080 | AMD Radeon™ RX 5700 XT | Intel® Arc™ A770
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 10 MB available space

short_description: A multiplayer survival horror game where players must choose their allies carefully to survive imminent danger. In this social-deduction game players won't know who to trust with their lives.
